CatDescriptText: Mr. Henry C. Taylor, 652 Hollis Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "I would say that it is because of more crime. In the Hill district, most of the crimes are committed by persons who do not live in the area.  This increase the crime rate in the Hill.  Therefore, there have to be more police raids."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Henry C. Taylor wearing dark hat, eyeglasses, moustache, and bolero tie with elk, standing in front of May Building with Thrift Drugs, corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Downtown
